intro: Allionia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered allionia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is a popular choice among gardeners in Mediterranean climates.
